meanings.definition: Having a feeling of fear or unease
meanings.sent1: The dark alley felt creepier as the night grew darker.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie became creepier as the suspense built up.
meanings.sent3: The spooky ghost story made everyone feel a little creepier.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house was even creepier than expected.
meanings.sent5: The shadowy figure lurking in the fog was the creepier thing I had ever seen.

meanings.definition: Causing a sensation of fear or unease
meanings.sent1: The haunted house had a creepier atmosphere than I had imagined.
meanings.sent2: The strange noise coming from the attic was getting creepier by the minute.
meanings.sent3: The creepy clown costume made the party a little creepier.
meanings.sent4: The old, creaky staircase seemed even creepier in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned graveyard at night was the creepier place I had ever been to.

meanings.sent1: The cat crept creepier towards its prey, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent2: The spy moved creepier through the shadows to avoid detection.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's stealthy movements became even creepier in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The snake slithered creepier across the forest floor, unnoticed by its prey.
meanings.sent5: The thief moved creepier through the darkened room, searching for valuables.
